Newer compression algorithm (often better than Gzip)
Compressing images, resizing, and using modern formats (WebP, AVIF)
Modern image format providing superior compression for web images
Newer image format with even better compression than WebP (limited support initially, now growing)

q: What is 'Alt Attribute' vs 'Title Attribute' on image?
o: Alt is for accessibility/SEO (fallback text); Title is a tooltip (hover)

q: Should you keyword stuff Alt text?
o: No, describe the image naturally including keywords if relevant. Stuffing is spam.
Image that adds no information (e.g. border, background). Should have empty alt="".
Scalable Vector Graphics. Search engines index them. Code text inside is readable.
Metadata embedded in image files (Camera model, GPS, Date). Google might use it for image context.
Searching using an image as the query to find similar images or sources
Image recognition technology designed to bring up relevant information related to objects it identifies

q: What is 'Semantic HTML' importance for crawling?
o: Helps bots understand the structure and meaning of content (nav, main, footer, article)
Container for introductory content or navigation links
Section of page intended for navigation links
Thematic grouping of content, typically with a heading
Content marginally related to the main content (Sidebar)
Only one visible <main> element per page
Hierarchical structure of headings. H1 is main, H2 sub, etc. Crucial for outline.
Helps organize information (Featured Snippets love lists)
Good for structured data comparison (Featured Snippets love tables)
Content inside iframe may not be associated with the parent page (treated as separate page)
Obsolete technology. Not indexable or supported by browsers anymore.
Small icon displayed in browser tab and search results (Brand visibility)
Use high quality square image, define in <link rel='icon'>
Meta tags for social media sharing (Facebook, etc.). Not direct SEO factor but drives traffic.
Meta tags for Twitter sharing display
Truncation is actually based on pixel width (e.g. 600px for title), not just char count
Sensationalist headlines to attract clicks (can lead to high bounce rate/pogo-sticking)
Regularly updating/refreshing content to keep it current
Decline in traffic/rankings for older content as it becomes outdated
Percentage of times a keyword appears on a page (Old metric, focus on natural language)
Mathematical method used to determine the relationship between terms (often used as synonym for related keywords)
